verses.verse: Praise to God in His Holiness and Majesty A Psalm of David. [1] Give (1 Chr. 16:28, 29) unto the LORD, O you mighty ones, Give unto the LORD glory and strength.
Give unto the LORD the glory due to His name; Worship the LORD in (2 Chr. 20:21; Ps. 110:3) the beauty of holiness.
The voice of the LORD is over the waters; ((Job 37:4, 5); Ps. 18:13; Acts 7:2) The God of glory thunders; The LORD is over many waters.
The voice of the LORD is powerful; The voice of the LORD is full of majesty.
The voice of the LORD breaks (Judg. 9:15; 1 Kin. 5:6; Ps. 104:16; Is. 2:13; 14:8) the cedars, Yes, the LORD splinters the cedars of Lebanon.
(Ps. 114:4) He makes them also skip like a calf, Lebanon and (Deut. 3:9) Sirion like a young wild ox.
The voice of the LORD divides the flames of fire.
The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness; The LORD shakes the Wilderness of (Num. 13:26) Kadesh.
The voice of the LORD makes the (Job 39:1) deer give birth, And strips the forests bare; And in His temple everyone says, “Glory!”
The (Gen. 6:17; Job 38:8, 25) LORD sat enthroned at the Flood, And (Ps. 10:16) the LORD sits as King forever.
(Ps. 28:8; 68:35; (Is. 40:29)) The LORD will give strength to His people; The LORD will bless His people with peace.
